definition: to excuse sb/to exempt/to remove or dismiss from office/to avoid/to avert/to escape/to be prohibited

sentences.english: It was the immunity provision that dominated most of the debate on the bill in Congress.
sentences.chinese: 正是这个豁免权条款成为国会对议案进行辩论的焦点。

sentences.english: How shall the criminal responsibility of foreigners who enjoy diplomatic privileges and immunities be investigated?
sentences.chinese: 享有外交特权和豁免权的外国人的刑事责任怎样追究？

sentences.english: He claimed diplomatic immunity to avoid being arrested.
sentences.chinese: 为了避免被捕，他声称享有外交豁免权。

sentences.english: In addition, they say the plan would give Mr. Saleh immunity from prosecution.
sentences.chinese: 他们还表示，该计划将给予萨利赫免受起诉的豁免权。

sentences.english: Mr Chen, divested of presidential immunity, now faces a corruption investigation.
sentences.chinese: 陈生被剥夺了总桶豁免权，面临贪污质询。

sentences.english: The bill also revokes diplomatic immunity for UN officials.
sentences.chinese: 这份法案还撤销了对联合国官员的外交豁免权。

sentences.english: The database security administrator can also grant exemptions to users.
sentences.chinese: 数据库安全管理员还可以为用户授予豁免权。

sentences.english: No balance sheet provided with the release.
sentences.chinese: 公司因为有豁免权而不公布只产负债表。

sentences.english: Use of waivers for expediting resources through customs.
sentences.chinese: 为了加快资源运送的关税豁免权的使用。

sentences.english: Immunity from prosecution is extended to all members of Ishii's team.
sentences.chinese: 起诉豁免权延伸至所有成员石井的团队。

definition: right (i.e. an entitlement to sth)/(classical) power and wealth
signatory states/countries that are party to a treaty
